question_metadata.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?

responses_by_article.article_title: A Pricing Framework for Software-as-a-Service
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: Data collected September 1, 2012 from 353 SaaS vendors, with market forecasts to 2014. Article published 2014. Maturity status: Growing (SaaS has proliferated over past decade with signs of continued/accelerated growth; described as 'emerging business model' but with established practices)
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'software-as-a-service (SaaS) has proliferated over the past decade and there are signs to suggest that this growth is likely to continue or even accelerate in the near future' | Page 1: 'Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)...is an emerging business model that is expected to grow rapidly' | Page 3: 'The data collection work was done on September 1, 2012' | Page 1: '©2014 IEEE' | Page 6: 'As an emerging business model, SaaS is attracting more and more attention from both the software industry and the academia'

responses_by_article.article_title: Selection of the Proper Revenue and Pricing Model for SaaS
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Growing maturity - Study published 2014, examining firms established between 1998-2008; SaaS evolved from ASP in late 1990s; market showing transition from traditional licensing to cloud-based rental models with increasing adoption
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: '2014 IEEE 6th International Conference on Cloud Computing Technology and Science' | Page 1-2: 'The SaaS model evolved from Application Service Provisioning (ASP) in the late 1990s' | Page 3: 'Firm A... established in 1998, acted purely as a service firm until 2009, when it started to develop its own software product' | Page 3: 'Firm B, established in 2000' | Page 4: 'Firm C was launched in 2008' | Page 4: 'Firm D was established in 2006' | Page 1: 'software renting is becoming more frequent in the new era of computing'

responses_by_article.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: 2011-2014 (with company history from mid-1990s to 2014). Maturity status: Growing - The cloud/SaaS business model was in active transition phase, moving from emerging to more consolidated state through hybrid approach.
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 4, Section 4.2: 'ERP Co was founded in the mid-1990s as provider of marine software' | Page 5, Section 5.2.1: 'Though ERP Co's SaaS journey has started since early 2000 by providing some simple applications through the web, the official transition towards a cloud-based business model was initiated around 2011' | Page 6, Section 5.2.2: 'A solution arrived in 2014 when the management recognized the issues in rushing towards cloud' | Page 6, Section 5.2.2: 'The goal as of 2014 for ERP Co is to start selling SaaS products to all the new customers in 2015' | Page 4, Section 4: 'we investigate the (still on-going) process of which ERP Co made the shift towards a SaaS-based business model.'

responses_by_article.article_title: Managing a Software Business
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: September/October 2016 publication. Maturity status: Consolidated - The article discusses software business models as established practice with Internet and cloud computing making service components easy to include.
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'SEPTEMBER/OCTOBER 2016 | IEEE SOFTWARE' | Page 1: 'Thanks to the Internet and cloud computing, it's now easy to include a service component into any type of software.' | Page 3: 'With software increasingly being offered as a service'

responses_by_article.article_title: Digital sustainable business models: Using digital technology to integrate ecological sustainability into the core of business models
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: Start-ups between 4-10 years old (founded approximately 2010-2018 given 2022 data collection). Maturity status: Growing - Digital sustainable BMs are emerging and establishing in the market, with some reaching unicorn status (>$1B valuation), demonstrating lasting market establishment is possible.
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 7, Section 3.2: 'We only included start-ups with ecological sustainable value propositions that are between 4 and 10 years old to ensure that they have solidified their BM (Innocenti & Zampi, 2019) and that they can still be considered start-ups (Kollmann et al., 2020).' | Page 1, Abstract: 'Received: 31 January 2022' | Page 19, Section 5.4: 'Digital ecology is only an emerging topic in both research and practice.' | Page 19, Section 5.3: 'The sample contains recently founded companies and start-ups valued at more than 1 billion US dollars, demonstrating that a lasting and successful establishment in the market is possible for digital sustainable BMs.'

responses_by_article.article_title: When does a freemium business model lead to high performance? — A qualitative comparative analysis based on fuzzy Sets
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: 2009-2022 data collection period, with article received July 2023, accepted January 2024. Maturity status: Consolidated - Freemium model has grown from 25% of Apple App Store in 2009 to over 80% in 2022, demonstrating widespread adoption and maturity.
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1, Introduction: 'the share of freemium apps on the Apple App Store rose from 25 % in 2009 to over 80 % in 2022. Additionally, App Store subscriptions increased from 745 million in 2021 to 900 million in 2022.' | Page 3, Section 2.1: 'As an emerging business model, the freemium business model has received considerable attention from business research in recent years' | Page 1: 'Received 4 July 2023; Received in revised form 17 January 2024; Accepted 22 January 2024'

Satakunta used it from 2004 until 2014 and Varsinais-Suomi began in February 2006 and is still using it' | Page 6: 'Satakunta Region took the decision to discontinue using the RHIS on 2014' | Page 6: 'Varsinais-Suomi region is still using the RHIS but also having discussions whether to continue or not' | Page 1: 'Accessed 1 May 2017' indicates article written around 2017

responses_by_article.article_title: Onboarding customer companies to electronic invoicing platform – developing a marketing and a partnering strategy for Tieto, an e-invoicing service provider
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Growing maturity - EDI-based e-invoicing emerged in 1970s-1980s, XML-based platforms are recent developments (contemporary to article), market is rapidly expanding globally but large part still untapped
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 3-4: 'Structured e-invoicing was already implemented in the 1970s when the development of EDI standard and EDIFACT (EDI for administration) enabled the transfer of structured data in electronic format between business partners... Recently, new XML-based standards have enabled a shift from point-to-point data exchange to development of network-based many-to-many platforms' | Page 1: 'e-invoicing is rapidly gaining ground in all industries and all geographical areas, but still a very large part of the global market is there for taking' | Page 5: 'Such interoperability agreements are a growing trend in the e-invoicing market'

responses_by_article.article_title: How Service Offerings and Operational Maturity Influence the Viability of Health Information Exchanges
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Growing maturity - Study period 2008-2010, with HIEs ranging from 1-10 years old; market showing upward trend but still relatively nascent with high failure rates; evolving from early experimental stage to more established operational models
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 3: 'We use a unique archival dataset constructed from surveys of HIEs in the United States from 2008 to 2010' | Page 8: 'The age of the HIEs ranges from 1 to 10 years.' | Page 4: 'Evidence suggests that HIEs are still experimenting with and transforming their operational strategy to better align with varying customer needs, and they are still learning how to best orient their resources and capabilities for optimal value creation. This is true in any nascent market in which customer needs and product/service offerings co-evolve with each other.' | Page 2: 'despite an upward trend in operational HIEs from 25% in 2009 to 30% in 2012'

responses_by_article.article_title: Mobile ticketing services in the Northern Europe: Critical business model issues
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: 2009-2017 (SMS ticketing launched 2009, apps introduced 2013-2014, BIBO in pilot phase 2015-2017). Maturity status: Growing (evolving from SMS to apps to BIBO, but facing adoption challenges with <10% penetration in most markets except Norway with >40%)
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'In some Northern Europe countries mobile ticketing solutions became available starting from 2009' | Page 3: 'SMS ticketing was commercially launched by local public transport companies in Sweden and Copenhagen around 2009' | Page 4: 'Around 2013–2014 public transport companies started introduction of mobile ticketing apps. First, only single tickets were available in these apps. Currently (by 2017), the majority of apps offer partial or almost full range of period tickets' | Page 4: 'Ruter runs a pilot tests on one of bus lines in Oslo, and Jiffi pilots are running in Tallinn and Tartu' | Page 1: 'Notable trends in mobile ticketing are introduction of "Be-In Be-Out" (BIBO) seamless ticketing solutions'

responses_by_article.article_title: The effect of free sampling strategies on freemium conversion rates
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Consolidated - Freemium has become ubiquitous across software, games and web services; study conducted in 2016-2017 examining established model adopted by major companies (Yahoo, Skype, Spotify, Dropbox)
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'Freemium business models, where companies offer a free basic and a value-enhanced paid version of a product, have become ubiquitous across software, games and a broad range of web services.' | Page 2: 'Freemium has been adopted by many established companies as well as nascent ventures ranging from Freemail providers like Yahoo, telecommunication providers like Skype over Music as a Service providers like Spotify to cloud storage providers like Dropbox.' | Page 1: 'Received: 27 January 2016 /Accepted: 22 September 2016 /Published online: 12 November 2016'

responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?

responses_by_article.article_title: Transition to the Cloud: A Vendor Perspective
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
responses_by_article.extracted_value: Observed period: Early 2000s - 2015 (ongoing). ERP Co's SaaS journey started early 2000s, official transition 2011-2015 (ongoing at time of study). Maturity status: Growing - 'cloud computing as a trend is here to stay', 'increasingly more widely accepted', market still evolving with major vendors transitioning.
responses_by_article.source_citation: Page 1: 'More than just a buzzword, cloud computing as a trend is here to stay. Nowadays, it has been increasingly more widely accepted' | Page 5: 'Though ERP Co's SaaS journey has started since early 2000 by providing some simple applications through the web, the official transition towards a cloud-based business model was initiated around 2011' | Page 2: 'We investigate the (still on-going) process of which ERP Co made the shift towards a SaaS-based business model'

responses_by_article.article_title: Business models and opportunity creation: How IT entrepreneurs create and develop business models under uncertainty
responses_by_article.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
